title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki
content:

jstoldt joined #xwiki at 08:10  
jstoldt - (08:10): morning everybody  
mflorea joined #xwiki at 08:12  
sdumitriu joined #xwiki at 09:02  
kwoot joined #xwiki at 09:15  
kwoot - (09:15): Hello: should this hql query work: select doc.fullName from XWikiDocument doc where doc.space='IT Projecten' and doc.getName like 'Project Kennismanagement - Stage 1 - Highlight Report d.d. %' order by doc.date asc  
kwoot - (09:15): because it crashes the page.  
kwoot - (09:16): I can' t find what I'm doing wrong here..  
sdumitriu - (09:16): doc.name  
sdumitriu - (09:16): getName is not a property, is a method  
kwoot - (09:17): damn! I have been looking at this thing for hours.  
kwoot - (09:17): Thanks!  
kwoot - (09:21): But if the results is an empty array the page still crashes, right?  
sdumitriu - (09:22): No, it shouldn't crash  
sdumitriu - (09:23): Note that with that query you should use $xwiki.search, not $xwiki.searchDocuments  
vmassol joined #xwiki at 09:23  
sdumitriu - (09:23): But you should instead do:  
sdumitriu - (09:23): $xwiki.searchDocuments("where doc.space ..."  
kwoot - (09:24): One moment...  
vmassol - (09:24): sdumitriu: I have a first version of a cache macro ready. Where can I commit it?  
vmassol - (09:24): (good morning btw :))  
sdumitriu - (09:24): Morning...  
sdumitriu - (09:25): I think it's safe to put it in the final place  
sdumitriu - (09:25): To not have it used by default, you can not activate it in the parent pom, and not depend on it  
vmassol - (09:26): sdumitriu: it's a macro  
vmassol - (09:26): so there's no notion of activation  
vmassol - (09:26): you use it or you don't  
sdumitriu - (09:26): activate = list it as submodule  
vmassol - (09:26): it's not going to cause any problem to existing stuff  
vmassol - (09:26): why not make it avail I don't understand?  
sdumitriu - (09:26): Then why do you ask where to put it?  
vmassol - (09:27): either RC1 or RC2  
vmassol - (09:27): I don't know where you are with the release  
sdumitriu - (09:27): Ah  
kwoot - (09:27): @sdumitriuL this code crashes: #set($results =$xwiki.searchDocuments("where doc.space='IT Projecten' and doc.name like '$basis2' order by doc.date asc ") )   #foreach ($item in $results)    #\* $item   #end  
sdumitriu - (09:27): brb  
kwoot - (09:27): Wait, is it that simple....  
kwoot - (09:28): yep, the # before the \* $items must not be there.  
kwoot - (09:28): so an empty foreach crashes? lets test..  
kwoot - (09:29): no offcourse not. It is just a stupid syntax error.  
vmassol - (09:29): jvelociter: I have a first version ready of teh czche macro  
kwoot - (09:29): my bad. Boy do I feel stupid.  
kwoot - (09:30): damn, and now it is logged as well :-)  
sdumitriu left at 09:31 (Ping timeout: 240 seconds  
sdumitriu joined #xwiki at 09:40  
venkatna joined #xwiki at 09:41  
sdumitriu - (09:42): kwoot: The #\* is a start comment syntax  
sdumitriu - (09:42): So:#\* $item #end  
sdumitriu - (09:42): Means that #end is commented  
sburjan joined #xwiki at 09:42  
sdumitriu - (09:42): Thus #foreach does not end, thus syntax error  
sdumitriu - (09:43): vmassol: cache macro, better for 3.0  
vmassol - (09:43): sdumitriu: we need it for xwiki.org  
sdumitriu - (09:43): RC2 isn't supposed to happen unless it's an emergency  
sdumitriu - (09:43): Hm, how quick can you commit it?  
vmassol - (09:44): now  
vmassol - (09:44): in 10 minutes  
sdumitriu - (09:44): I have to check my changes for the escapetool refactoring  
sburjan - (09:44): sdumitriu, vmassol : FYI I will be tseting 2.7 snapshot today  
sdumitriu - (09:44): sburjan: Great  
sburjan - (09:46): vmassol, sdumitriu : could you please vote on the IRC thread (on the mailing list)  
vmassol - (09:46): sburjan: there's no need to vote I think  
sburjan - (09:47): vmassol: well the actual patch is notthe one that won the vote .. most people voted so we don't have <> surrounding the nickname .. and I sent a new proposal explaining the options we have  
sdumitriu - (09:48): I have the patch ready to be committed  
sdumitriu - (09:48): Just waiting for 1-2 +1  
silviar joined #xwiki at 09:48  
vmassol - (09:49): there's no need to vote for this  
vmassol - (09:49): but you can do it  
vmassol - (09:49): I'm +1 for whatever  
vmassol - (09:49): if that helps you  
vmassol - (09:50): (you're talking about IRC paztch right?)  
sburjan - (09:50): vote so we have it there.. maybe others will start to vote too. It's kinda bad because I've put in the email the colored syntax too, but it seems that our mailing system delivers only in plaing text as far as I can sii  
sburjan - (09:50): vmassol: yes  
sburjan - (09:50): sdumitriu: reviewed it 2 days ago  
rrodriguez left at 09:54 (Ping timeout: 245 seconds  
sdumitriu - (09:55): The lock inside XWiki.getXWiki is really bad  
sdumitriu - (09:56): It can bring an entire farm down if one thread is doing intensive work  
mflorea - (09:58): vmassol: Hi. I need to apply additional cleaning filters when an office document is imported. So there is a cleaner component which uses multiple filters (which are also components) but their hints are hard-coded. I'm not sure what's best to do: (1) "overwrite" somehow the cleaner component (2) modify the cleaner component to look for a "custom" hint filter. WDYT?  
vmassol - (10:01): mflorea:AFAIR it's already supported in the code. But I need to check it  
vmassol - (10:01): sdumitriu: what should I do for the cache macro?  
mflorea - (10:02): vmassol: what's supported is to get the cleaner configuration and add filters but I can't do that because the cleaner is internal to the office importer module. I want to hook custom HTML filters.  
vmassol - (10:03): mflorea: i don't understand  
vmassol - (10:03): you're talking about modiuign the office importer no?  
vmassol - (10:03): \*modifying  
mflorea - (10:04): well, ideally I should be able to add my filters without modifying the office import module. These filters are very specific, they have no value for the platform.  
vmassol - (10:04): sdumitriu: I can wait for 3.0 I guess but we'll need some hacking to be able to use it for xwiki.org (need to overwrite the macro tx jar + add the new cache macro jar)  
mflorea - (10:04): ideally I would just drop my jar in WEB-INF/lib and the office importer cleaner would use them  
vmassol - (10:05): hmmm that said we don't really need it for xwiki.org, there's a workaround  
vmassol - (10:05): which is to stop xwiki.org, edit the properties file and hardcode the page to be cache since we alreayd have a rendering cache at the page level  
vmassol - (10:05): sdumitriu: ok I'll wait then  
vmassol - (10:06): mflorea: then you'd need different roles  
vmassol - (10:06): and you no longer have control over what filter to use  
vmassol - (10:07): which is bad from a programatic POV  
vmassol - (10:07): it's better to pass a list from an api pov  
mflorea - (10:08): hmm, you can control what jars you have in your WEB-INF/lib  
vmassol - (10:08): but the code that passes the list could auto dsicover for a given use case  
vmassol - (10:08): mflorea: there are differnet levels  
vmassol - (10:08): API level  
vmassol - (10:08): instance level  
vmassol - (10:08): at the api level there's no notion web-inf/lib at all  
mflorea - (10:08): right  
vmassol - (10:08): it's really hard for a dev  
vmassol - (10:08): to have to create a custom classloader  
vmassol - (10:09): overwrit ethe default CL with his own oe  
vmassol - (10:09): one  
vmassol - (10:09): to be able to control what gets passed  
vmassol - (10:09): remmeber your discussion about this the other day  
vmassol - (10:09): :)  
vmassol - (10:09): but as I said  
vmassol - (10:09): we can have 2 levels  
vmassol - (10:09): at our API level we pass a list of filters  
vmassol - (10:10): as it's done now  
vmassol - (10:10): it's just the caller that can decide how he gets that list  
mflorea - (10:13): ok. but in the office importer case, there is a custom HTML cleaner that uses the default HTML cleaner from xwiki-xml module. The custom office importer HTML cleaner gets the default cleaner configuration and adds his own filters. I was thinking about: (1) modify the office importer cleaner to add one more filter with hint "custom" (or what ever) in order to allow custom filtering or (2) overwrite somehow the office importer cleaner (MyCustomOfficeImportClea  
mflorea - (10:14): s/the hint of the office importer filter/the hint of the office importer cleaner  
vmassol - (10:16): what you could do I guess is have a new role for filters for the office importer  
jvelo joined #xwiki at 10:24  
mflorea - (10:25): vmassol: but wdyt about component implementation overwriting? Let's say I have a component and an implementation with hint "foo". Later I want to "redirect" the "foo" hint to a new implementation. Is this advisable?  
vmassol - (10:26): mflorea: yes but not for us  
vmassol - (10:26): for users  
vmassol - (10:26): this is the mechanism for users to change xwiki behaviors  
vmassol - (10:27): (when we don't offer explicit extension points)  
mflorea - (10:27): how would a user do that? For instance, how would a user replace the velocity macro, using the same hint.  
jvelo left at 10:27 (Client Quit  
jvdrean joined #xwiki at 10:27  
vmassol - (10:28): mflorea: here: http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Component+Module#HOverrides  
sabageru joined #xwiki at 10:28  
mflorea - (10:30): vmassol: great! So this means I can write a custom HTML cleaner (which extends the office import cleaner) and overwrite the office importer cleaner.  
vmassol - (10:30): yes  
vmassol - (10:30): but this shouldn't be done in our svn  
mflorea - (10:31): so cool, I wasn't aware of component-overrides.txt  
mflorea - (10:31): sure, it's not for platform  
vmassol - (10:31): ok  
jstoldt - (10:36): mflorea: will this address: http://jira.xwiki.org/jira/browse/XE-745  
jstoldt - (10:36): ?  
jstoldt - (10:36): the change you were just discussing, i mean  
jstoldt - (10:36): ah crap, wrong one, my bad  
jstoldt - (10:36): hold on  
jstoldt - (10:37): http://jira.xwiki.org/jira/browse/XWIKI-5577

sburjan - (10:38): except JIRA, ofc

jvelociter - (12:23): vmassol: I'm not sure the note about obsolete technologies is relevant in where you've put it  
jvelociter - (12:24): It should not be the first you see when you land on extensions.xwiki.org  
jvelociter - (12:24): plus, all obsolete extensions are marked as such on their own page  
jvelociter - (12:24): so you get to know they are obsolete before you install / use them

vmassol - (12:25): yeah maybe  
vmassol - (12:25): I put it there so that users know what to pick before they start picking  
vmassol - (12:25): hmmm  
vmassol - (12:26): maybe we should actually have the type named "Plugin (Obsolete)"

vmassol - (12:28): ;)

lucaa1 - (16:01): guys, how can I find out how to use the maven xar plugin?  
vmassol - (16:01): lucaa1: you can check modules that use it  
lucaa1 - (16:01): I want to build a .xar from its xar dependencies but also excluding some files in the deps, overwriting, etc  
vmassol - (16:01): or read XarMojo  
lucaa1 - (16:02): I looked in the enterprise wiki pom  
lucaa1 - (16:02): but that's very straightforward  
vmassol - (16:02): you just need to check the class variables  
vmassol - (16:02): they correspond to the config options  
vmassol - (16:02): http://svn.xwiki.org/svnroot/xwiki/platform/xwiki-tools/trunk/xwiki-xar-plugin/src/main/java/com/xpn/xwiki/tool/xar/AbstractXarMojo.java  
vmassol - (16:03): let me list them for you:  
vmassol - (16:03):   protected String[] includes;  
vmassol - (16:03): protected String[] excludes;  
vmassol - (16:03): project.build.sourceEncoding  
vmassol - (16:03): that's all  
lucaa1 - (16:03): ok  
vmassol - (16:03): basically all fields that are tagged with  
vmassol - (16:03): @parameter  
vmassol - (16:04): (and not @readonly)  
lucaa1 - (16:04): how do I find out if a file in the current project will overwrite a file in a dependency or not?  
jvelociter left at 16:04 (Quit: jvelociter  
lucaa1 - (16:04): without trial and error  
lucaa1 - (16:04): how can I know what should be the right behaviour?  
vmassol - (16:04):        // Ensure that we don't overwrite XML document files present in this project since  
vmassol - (16:04):             // we want those to be used and not the ones in the dependent XAR.  
vmassol - (16:04):             unArchiver.setOverwrite(overwrite);  
vmassol - (16:04): hmm  
vmassol - (16:05): need to read the code more  
vmassol - (16:05): ok done  
vmassol - (16:05): overwrite is false  
lucaa1 - (16:05): we should really document this, like for normal people  
vmassol - (16:05): it's hardcoded to false  
lucaa1 - (16:05): because it's a very cool plugin  
vmassol - (16:05): lucaa1: great thanks  
vmassol - (16:05): yep  
vmassol - (16:05): there's evena jira issue for that I think  
lucaa1 - (16:05): ok, can I exclude a file only from a dep?  
vmassol - (16:06): I don't think so  
lucaa1 - (16:06): so that I can sortof control which of the dependencies overwrites it  
lucaa1 - (16:06): ftm it's ok  
vmassol - (16:06): see     protected void unpackDependentXars() throws MojoExecutionException

vmassol - (16:06): it's small
